[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Move VM] [Bytecode Injection] Can malicious bytecode call these natives with hand-crafted Type values that bypass Move's type checker, enabling type confusion attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Move VM] [Type Instantiation Timing] Are types fully instantiated before being passed to these natives, or can partially instantiated types cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Move VM] [Module Resolution] When converting StructTag to TypeInfo with module names, can module resolution failures cause inconsistent behavior between validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Move VM] [Type Cache Poisoning] Can repeatedly calling these natives with many different types exhaust the type cache, causing performance degradation or cache thrashing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Move VM] [Resource Type Leakage] Can these natives be used to determine whether a type is a resource type, potentially enabling resource duplication or destruction attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [String Formatting Variation] Can platform differences in std::fmt::Write cause to_canonical_string() to produce different outputs on different validator architectures, breaking consensus? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [Module Name Encoding] Are module names guaranteed to have consistent byte encoding across all validators, or can UTF-8 normalization differences cause divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [Type Argument Ordering] If type_args have non-deterministic ordering in some edge cases, can this cause different TypeInfo outputs across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [Gas Evaluation Conditional] The eval_gas() check at line 59 - can different gas schedules cause this to evaluate differently across validators, leading to different execution paths? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [SmallVec Heap Allocation] Can different memory allocators cause SmallVec to make different heap vs inline storage decisions, affecting execution timing and determinism? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Determinism] [Error Return Values] When SafeNativeError is returned, are error codes guaranteed to be identical across validators, or can error handling introduce non-determinism? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Consensus] [Chain ID Consistency] If chain_id is not identical across all validators (due to misconfiguration), can this cause validators to produce different execution results and fork? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Consensus] [Type Resolution Timing] Can race conditions in type loading or caching cause some validators to resolve types differently, leading to inconsistent TypeInfo outputs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Consensus] [Gas Underflow] If gas charging fails due to underflow or overflow, can some validators continue execution while others abort, causing consensus failure? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Consensus] [Debug Assert Divergence] Since debug_assert!() is compiled out in release builds, can debug vs release builds produce different behavior, causing validator set divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Gas Economics] [Base Cost Inadequacy] Is TYPE_INFO_TYPE_OF_BASE sufficient to cover the cost of type_to_type_tag() for complex types, or can attackers cause computational DoS with minimal gas expenditure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Gas Economics] [Per-Byte Cost Calibration] Is TYPE_INFO_TYPE_OF_PER_BYTE_IN_STR correctly calibrated - can attackers find type structures where the actual cost far exceeds the charged gas? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Gas Economics] [Type Name Cost Asymmetry] Does type_name() charge the same per-byte cost as type_of() - can attackers exploit cost differences between these functions for gas arbitrage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/framework/src/natives/type_info.rs] [Gas Economics] [Chain ID Cost] Is TYPE_INFO_CHAIN_ID_BASE appropriate given that chain_id() performs an extension lookup - can massive parallel calls to chain_id() cause DoS? (Medium)
